name: memento
description: Don't believe his lies. Context simulator and token optimizer for Claude Code — know exactly what you're loading before you hit rate limits.
author: Oezguer Celebi

commands.name: memento
commands.description: "What do I know?" — Analyze current project context and token usage. Like Leonard's condition, your context window has limits.

commands.name: memento:polaroid
commands.description: "Take a Polaroid" — Preview token cost before adding files to context. Don't trust your memory, trust the photo.

commands.name: memento:tattoo
commands.description: "The facts I choose to tattoo" — Show what's ALWAYS loaded into context. These are your permanent memories.

commands.name: memento:burn
commands.description: "Burn the evidence" — Get recommendations for reducing token usage. Identify what memories to destroy.

commands.name: memento:case
commands.description: "Investigate the case" — Deep analysis comparing different context strategies. Like Leonard solving Teddy's case.

commands.name: memento:budget
commands.description: "Plan within your condition" — Calculate how many files you can add within a token budget. Know your limits.

agents.name: leonard
agents.description: Context optimization specialist — helps reorganize your project to minimize token usage

skills.name: token-estimation
skills.description: Token counting reference for accurate context size estimation

optionalDependencies.tiktoken: For accurate token counts (falls back to estimation)
